alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 15 at 2:49AM PDT until March 15 at 11:36PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snow melt continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, Riverside County Mountains, San Bernardino County Mountains and San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning. * WHEN...Until 2 PM PDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A Pacific storm system with moisture from an Atmospheric River will produce heavy rain on existing snow cover in the mountains, resulting in elevated stream flows and possible flooding. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
